workout_title: Upper Body Sculpt: Chest, Shoulders, and Triceps

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.
Interlock fingers behind your back and gently lift arms while pushing chest forward. Perform 2 sets of 15 seconds.
Raise one arm overhead, bend the elbow, and use the opposite hand to gently push the elbow back. Perform 2 sets of 15 seconds each arm.
Roll shoulders forward and backward in a circular motion. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

exercises.setup: Set the bench to a 30-45 degree incline. Lie back with feet flat on the floor and grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Unrack the barbell and hold it above your chest with arms fully extended.
2. Lower the barbell slowly to your upper chest, keeping elbows at a 45-degree angle.
3. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select dumbbells that allow you to complete 8-10 reps with proper form, usually around 60-70% of your max effort for this movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlling the weight throughout the movement and avoid bouncing the bar off your chest.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and attach a bar. Stand facing away from the machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with both hands and step forward to create tension.
2. Keep your elbows close to your head and extend your arms fully.
3. Slowly bend your elbows to lower the bar behind your head.
4. Extend your arms back to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with a full range of motion, focusing on the stretch at the top.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with control, focusing on the stretch and contraction.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a stable core to prevent arching your back during the movement.

exercises.setup: Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level. Sit with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor.
execution: 1. Grip the handles and press them forward until your arms are fully extended.
2. Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest.
3. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with a deep stretch and full range of motion.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with a focus on the stretch and contraction.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement for maximum engagement.

exercises.setup: Set the bar at chin level on the Smith machine. Lie back on a flat bench with feet flat on the floor.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a narrow grip and unrack it.
2. Lower the bar towards your chin, keeping elbows tucked.
3. Press the bar back up to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows for 8-10 reps, focusing on the triceps with minimal shoulder involvement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8-10 reps, focusing on triceps engagement.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows close to your body to maximize triceps activation.

exercises.setup: Sit on a bench with back support. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
execution: 1. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height.
3. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with proper form, focusing on shoulder engagement.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your core engaged and avoid arching your back during the press.
